issue.title: [C++] Support unquoted decimal in JSON parser
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17847](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17847). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
~~Add an option to parse decimal as unquoted numbers in JSON~~

Support both quoted and unquoted decimal in JSON parser automatically.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17847?focusedCommentId=17609545) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Can rapidJSON give us the original string representation of a number?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17847?focusedCommentId=17609549) by Jin Shang (jinshang):*
`[~apitrou]` Yes, by setting kParseNumbersAsStringsFlag, and we are using this feature: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/json/parser.cc#L682

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17847?focusedCommentId=17610659) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 14242
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14242>
